name: packaging box factory construction | packaging box factory | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5042/documentation

The dataset represents a packaging production site with a annual production of 14 kt and a total life time of 50 years.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



this module includes the land-use, buildings (hall), machineries for box production as well as the dismanteling/disposal of the whole infrastructure
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Land-use from 1 Swiss packaging box producer, used here for whole Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: estimation of typical technology for packaging box production
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Land-use data are based on one production site. Other information is rough estimation. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: literature and estimations from similar processes
